dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Kemp b Ntini 58 (76b 4x4 0x6 100m) SR: 76.31

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan falls. Slashed away to third man. What a fiesty knock it has been though. Full in length, outside off stump, Dilshan freed his arms at the width and  ended up slicing it away to Kemp at third man.

dismissalText.commentary: Russel Arnold c †Boucher b Langeveldt 50 (73b 2x4 0x6 99m) SR: 68.49

dismissalComment.html: Ah! Arnold falls. Full-pitched on the middle stump, Arnold goes down on a bent knee and attempts a slog across the line. He gets a top-edge which is snaffled up by Boucher.

headshotImage.caption: Charl Langeveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Charl Langeveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Got 'em. First ball of the over, wide of the stumps, good bounce and Jayasuriya lashes fiercely. He can't get the timing right and the ball flies off a thickish edge to Kallis at point, standing at the edge of the circle. Good bowling from Langeveldt after Pollock's poor spell. This is a huge wicket for South Africa

headshotImage.caption: DPMD Jayawardene headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: DPMD Jayawardene headshot

dismissalComment.html: gotcha! Done in by that away movement. Full in length, on the middle and leg stump line, Mahela shapes to wrist it away to the on side, the ball straightens and  takes the leading edge and pops up for de Villiers to hold a dolly at cover. South Africa are slowly taking control.

headshotImage.caption: Russel Arnold player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Russel Arnold player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Ah! Arnold falls. Full-pitched on the middle stump, Arnold goes down on a bent knee and attempts a slog across the line. He gets a top-edge which is snaffled up by Boucher.

headshotImage.caption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Another one goes, going for some quick runs. Maharoof lofted a full-length delivery high over extra cover. Three men converged on it. Ntini from deep cover, Smith running back from cover and Gibbs rushing across from long off. Finally it was Ntini who took it.

headshotImage.caption: Chaminda Vaas player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chaminda Vaas player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Langeveldt grabs a five-for. Three of them came in the over and would you believe it, it's a maiden to boot. What a over at the death.  Again full in length, Vaas has a swing but sends it down the throat of Gibbs at long-on.

headshotImage.caption: Makhaya Ntini player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Makhaya Ntini player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: WU Tharanga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WU Tharanga headshot

dismissalComment.html: Ntini nails Tharanga with one of his specials : a length-delivery that angles away from the left-hand batsman. Tharanga pushes at it, bat away from the body, and edges it low to Kemp at first slip who pouches it safely.

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c †Boucher b Hall 28 (38b 4x4 0x6 50m) SR: 73.68

dismissalComment.html: Sangakkara walks. It was banged in short and just outside leg stump, Sangakkara shaped to pull but the ball moved in a touch and cramped him up. The ball brushed the right glove and Boucher dived to his right to take it. The pair of Silva and Dilshan that took Sri Lanka out of trouble in the game against India will be on.

dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva run out (Gibbs) 9 (27b 1x4 0x6 44m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Gibbs does a Jonty! Remember that Inzamam-ul-Haq run out in 1992? Silva pushes a length-delivery on the off side,close on the off side and wants a run. Dilshan doesn't agree with that assessment and sends him back. Too late. Gibbs charges in, picks the ball and flies into the furniture. Gone! A YouTube moment.

dismissalText.commentary: Muthiah Muralidaran run out (Pollock) 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Pollock runs out Murali. The innings has folded up. Malinga pushed a fullish delivery to backward point where Pollock swooped on the ball, took aim and fired in a fatal direct hit.

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c †Sangakkara b Malinga 86 (110b 4x4 0x6 187m) SR: 78.18

dismissalComment.html: Would you believe it? Malinga has got the hat-trick! Full, furious, outside off stump, Kallis goes for a square-drive and nicks it behind. Loud appeal. Kallis stays rooted. Even louder appeal and Harper raises the fatal finger. SA eight down and choking real badly.

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: KC Sangakkara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KC Sangakkara headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith st †Sangakkara b Muralidaran 59 (65b 7x4 1x6 79m) SR: 90.76

dismissalComment.html: Murali gets his man. Lovely bit of cricket. Flighted delivery, on a length, outside off stump and Smith is sucked into a drive. He is beaten in the flight and then by the turn and Sangakkara whips the bails off in a flash. Smith was dragged out of the crease. And it was some philosphical reaction from Murali. As if he expected it. No pumping of the fist, no big celebration, he just walks towards his team-mates with a smile. The smiling assassin.

headshotImage.caption: SL Malinga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SL Malinga headshot

image.caption: Shaun Pollock profile
image.credit: United Cricket Board of South Africa

headshotImage.caption: Shaun Pollock player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaun Pollock player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: BINGO! Finally Malinga strikes, that is a superb bit of bowling. It's a slower ball on the stumps, Pollock just does not pick it, plays inside the line of the ball and loses his leg stump. Even with the game all but gone Sri Lanka are fighting. Pollock played a good hand but now he's gone!

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Hall player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Hall player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: ANOTHER! Andrew Hall goes off the very first ball! It's another speared-in yorker, Hall just about manages to dig it out, but he can't keep the ball down ... it bobs up into the air for the man at cover to pouch easily! Is there a twise left in this game

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Would you believe it? Malinga has got the hat-trick! Full, furious, outside off stump, Kallis goes for a square-drive and nicks it behind. Loud appeal. Kallis stays rooted. Even louder appeal and Harper raises the fatal finger. SA eight down and choking real badly.

headshotImage.caption: Makhaya Ntini player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Makhaya Ntini player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And then they were one! Malinga gets four in four. Unbelievable! Screaming yorker and Ntini drives, plays all over it  and ball crashes into the middle stump. Malinga is slinging down magic deliveries and SA are nine down.

headshotImage.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Murali gets his man. Lovely bit of cricket. Flighted delivery, on a length, outside off stump and Smith is sucked into a drive. He is beaten in the flight and then by the turn and Sangakkara whips the bails off in a flash. Smith was dragged out of the crease. And it was some philosphical reaction from Murali. As if he expected it. No pumping of the fist, no big celebration, he just walks towards his team-mates with a smile. The smiling assassin.

headshotImage.caption: Herschelle Gibbs player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Herschelle Gibbs player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Murali winks out Gibbs. Another flighted delivery and Gibbs is down the track. The ball dips rapidly on Gibbs who drives uppishly, low and to the right of Murali who dives to take the catch. SA need only 50 while SL need 7 wickets.

headshotImage.caption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Murali takes out Boucher. Two in two balls. Suddenly, SL are spinning back into the game. From round the stumps, it lands on the off and middle stump, quicker through the air, Boucher is caught at the crease and it spins in to catch him in front. The magician is unleashing his tricks.

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Vaas 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: beauty! de Villiers is cleaned up. Landed on a length, around off and middle and bend back like a banana. de Villiers pushes outside the line and the middle stump is pegged back. Death rattle. What a start for Sri Lanka.

dismissalComment.html: Would you believe it? Malinga has got the hat-trick! Full, furious, outside off stump, Kallis goes for a square-drive and nicks it behind. Loud appeal. Kallis stays rooted. Even louder appeal and Harper raises the fatal finger. SA eight down and choking real badly.

commentTextItems.html: Peterson does it for SA with a edge past the slip. Fullish, outside off stump, Peterson drives, gets a outside edge and it runs down to third man boundary. SA have won. They nearly choked but have pulled it off. Peterson jumps in the air, pumps his fist and then smashes the stumps down at the other end. Immediately apologises! What a cracker of a game!

commentPostTextItems.html: Phew! What a nerve-wracking finish. South Africa were cruising at one stage and were hit by a double strike by Murali. They recovered again, via a calm Kallis, and then, just when they were staring at the victory, they blinked. Malinga slinged slower ones  and fiery yorkers and blasted out four in a row. From there the game was hanging on a knife's edge. And in the end, an edgy drive to third man sealed it for South Africa.

Malinga: "I am feeling bad that we lost the game but I am happy that I took a hattrick. The old ball was going to reverse and I got the wickets. I tried to get five in a row but unfortunately didn't get it. ... We are a fighting team but I think we didn't have enough runs.

Man-of-the-Match: Langeveldt. It was awarded by Joe Solomon,former West Indies cricketer and the man who fired in the direct hit to tie the game against Australia in the famous Test in 1960-61. That was some game, this was not so bad either.

Mahela I thought the guys fought back well but the runs were not enough. Credit to the bowlers but we didn't have enough runs. ..... Overall we made lots of mistakes while batting, some loose shots and we didn't finish batting the full 50 overs. That came back to haunt us.
Smith I think i went from 26 to 40 in those last few overs. .... That spell at the end from Malinga really tested us. ... I am chuffed and happy to get away with 2 points from this game.
Well .... that's it from us. This is Sriram Veera signing off. Thanks for logging in and tuning in. Do join us tomorrow for New Zealand v West Indies game.

commentTextItems.html: Swing and a miss. What a cracking game this has been. Full and just outside off stump, slants away, he has a drive, but inside the line and the ball rushes past the outside edge.
Beaten again. Another one that angles away from Langeveldt who pushes at it, bat meets air, ball heads to Sangakkara. Malinga to bowl the next over.

commentTextItems.html: again another off cutter, around off stump, Langeveldt leans forward and defends. They were 206 for 5 staring at a win and what a turn around from there
off cutter, slanting away from the off stump, Langeveldt stretches forward, opens the bat-face, steers to point. Pure drama.
pushes it across Langeveldt who lets it go. He has taken the first three deliveries away. Will he bend the next one in?
beaten! Lands back of length, on the off stump line and shapes away, Langeveldt has a tentative poke - nervousness, can't blame him and is beaten

commentPreTextItems.html: 1 to tie and 2 to win. Only one wicket. It doesn't get closer than this. Slip in place. Mahela is making sure he gets the field right. Two slips in now.

commentTextItems.html: fullish, just outside off stump, pushed to cover
beauty, another delivery that teases the outside edge. Full and tailing away from off stump, drives and is beaten. What a fab over it has been.

this one bends in sharply from outside the off, Peterson defends carefully with bat held close to pad

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Kemp b Ntini 12 (13b 2x4 0x6 13m) SR: 92.3

dismissalComment.html: Ntini nails Tharanga with one of his specials : a length-delivery that angles away from the left-hand batsman. Tharanga pushes at it, bat away from the body, and edges it low to Kemp at first slip who pouches it safely.

dismissalText.commentary: Sanath Jayasuriya c Kallis b Langeveldt 26 (27b 4x4 0x6 44m) SR: 96.29

dismissalComment.html: Got 'em. First ball of the over, wide of the stumps, good bounce and Jayasuriya lashes fiercely. He can't get the timing right and the ball flies off a thickish edge to Kallis at point, standing at the edge of the circle. Good bowling from Langeveldt after Pollock's poor spell. This is a huge wicket for South Africa

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c de Villiers b Langeveldt 12 (31b 1x4 0x6 49m) SR: 38.7

dismissalComment.html: gotcha! Done in by that away movement. Full in length, on the middle and leg stump line, Mahela shapes to wrist it away to the on side, the ball straightens and  takes the leading edge and pops up for de Villiers to hold a dolly at cover. South Africa are slowly taking control.

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c †Boucher b Hall 28 (38b 4x4 0x6 50m) SR: 73.68

dismissalComment.html: Sangakkara walks. It was banged in short and just outside leg stump, Sangakkara shaped to pull but the ball moved in a touch and cramped him up. The ball brushed the right glove and Boucher dived to his right to take it. The pair of Silva and Dilshan that took Sri Lanka out of trouble in the game against India will be on.

dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Silva run out (Gibbs) 9 (27b 1x4 0x6 44m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Gibbs does a Jonty! Remember that Inzamam-ul-Haq run out in 1992? Silva pushes a length-delivery on the off side,close on the off side and wants a run. Dilshan doesn't agree with that assessment and sends him back. Too late. Gibbs charges in, picks the ball and flies into the furniture. Gone! A YouTube moment.

dismissalText.commentary: Farveez Maharoof c Ntini b Langeveldt 5 (9b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 55.55

dismissalText.commentary: Muthiah Muralidaran run out (Pollock) 1 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 100

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith st †Sangakkara b Muralidaran 59 (65b 7x4 1x6 79m) SR: 90.76

dismissalComment.html: Murali gets his man. Lovely bit of cricket. Flighted delivery, on a length, outside off stump and Smith is sucked into a drive. He is beaten in the flight and then by the turn and Sangakkara whips the bails off in a flash. Smith was dragged out of the crease. And it was some philosphical reaction from Murali. As if he expected it. No pumping of the fist, no big celebration, he just walks towards his team-mates with a smile. The smiling assassin.

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c †Sangakkara b Malinga 86 (110b 4x4 0x6 187m) SR: 78.18

dismissalComment.html: Would you believe it? Malinga has got the hat-trick! Full, furious, outside off stump, Kallis goes for a square-drive and nicks it behind. Loud appeal. Kallis stays rooted. Even louder appeal and Harper raises the fatal finger. SA eight down and choking real badly.

dismissalText.commentary: Herschelle Gibbs c & b Muralidaran 31 (51b 1x4 0x6 79m) SR: 60.78

dismissalComment.html: Murali winks out Gibbs. Another flighted delivery and Gibbs is down the track. The ball dips rapidly on Gibbs who drives uppishly, low and to the right of Murali who dives to take the catch. SA need only 50 while SL need 7 wickets.

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Boucher lbw b Muralidaran 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Murali takes out Boucher. Two in two balls. Suddenly, SL are spinning back into the game. From round the stumps, it lands on the off and middle stump, quicker through the air, Boucher is caught at the crease and it spins in to catch him in front. The magician is unleashing his tricks.

dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Pollock b Malinga 13 (24b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 54.16

dismissalComment.html: BINGO! Finally Malinga strikes, that is a superb bit of bowling. It's a slower ball on the stumps, Pollock just does not pick it, plays inside the line of the ball and loses his leg stump. Even with the game all but gone Sri Lanka are fighting. Pollock played a good hand but now he's gone!

dismissalText.commentary: Herschelle Gibbs c & b Muralidaran 31 (51b 1x4 0x6 79m) SR: 60.78

dismissalComment.html: Murali winks out Gibbs. Another flighted delivery and Gibbs is down the track. The ball dips rapidly on Gibbs who drives uppishly, low and to the right of Murali who dives to take the catch. SA need only 50 while SL need 7 wickets.

headshotImage.caption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Muttiah Muralitharan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Boucher lbw b Muralidaran 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Murali takes out Boucher. Two in two balls. Suddenly, SL are spinning back into the game. From round the stumps, it lands on the off and middle stump, quicker through the air, Boucher is caught at the crease and it spins in to catch him in front. The magician is unleashing his tricks.

headshotImage.caption: KC Sangakkara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KC Sangakkara headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Justin Kemp st †Sangakkara b Jayasuriya 5 (16b 0x4 0x6 23m) SR: 31.25

dismissalComment.html: Sangakkara produces a smart stumping.  Arm-ball outside the off stump and Kemp pushes inside the line and is beaten. Sangakkara whips the bails off, Kemps tries to slide it in but the foot is in the air! He is gone!

headshotImage.caption: SL Malinga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SL Malinga headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Pollock b Malinga 13 (24b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 54.16

dismissalComment.html: BINGO! Finally Malinga strikes, that is a superb bit of bowling. It's a slower ball on the stumps, Pollock just does not pick it, plays inside the line of the ball and loses his leg stump. Even with the game all but gone Sri Lanka are fighting. Pollock played a good hand but now he's gone!

headshotImage.caption: WU Tharanga headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: WU Tharanga headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Andrew Hall c Tharanga b Malinga 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: ANOTHER! Andrew Hall goes off the very first ball! It's another speared-in yorker, Hall just about manages to dig it out, but he can't keep the ball down ... it bobs up into the air for the man at cover to pouch easily! Is there a twise left in this game

headshotImage.caption: KC Sangakkara headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KC Sangakkara headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c †Sangakkara b Malinga 86 (110b 4x4 0x6 187m) SR: 78.18

dismissalComment.html: Would you believe it? Malinga has got the hat-trick! Full, furious, outside off stump, Kallis goes for a square-drive and nicks it behind. Loud appeal. Kallis stays rooted. Even louder appeal and Harper raises the fatal finger. SA eight down and choking real badly.

headshotImage.longCaption: SL Malinga headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Makhaya Ntini b Malinga 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: And then they were one! Malinga gets four in four. Unbelievable! Screaming yorker and Ntini drives, plays all over it  and ball crashes into the middle stump. Malinga is slinging down magic deliveries and SA are nine down.
